definition: Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang
abbr. for Macao 澳門|澳门/abbr. for Australia 澳大利亞|澳大利亚
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: We will accelerate the pilot program for the mainland, Hong Kong and Macao to use RMB as the settlement currency for trade in goods.
sentences.chinese: 加快推進與港澳地區貨物貿易的人民幣結算試點。

sentences.english: U. S. users all over the country and Hong Kong and Macao regions.
sentences.chinese: 我們的用戶遍及全國及港澳地區。

sentences.english: And are of foreign nationality and Hong Kong and Macao child.
sentences.chinese: 而且都是外國籍和港澳地區的孩子。

sentences.english: The export of frozen chicken to Hong Kong and Macao shall still be subject to relevant regulations as are practised to date.
sentences.chinese: 對港澳地區出口凍雞仍按現行的有關規定執行。

definition: mainland China (PRC excluding Hong Kong and Macau, but including islands such as Hainan)/Japan (used in Taiwan during Japanese colonization)
domestic and international/at home and abroad
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
ASEAN/abbr. for 東南亞國家聯盟|东南亚国家联盟[Dong1 nan2 ya4 Guo2 jia1 Lian2 meng2]
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
Guangdong province (Kwangtung) in south China, short name 粵|粤[Yue4], capital Guangzhou 廣州|广州
Asia/abbr. for 亞細亞洲|亚细亚洲[Ya4 xi4 ya4 Zhou1]
Hong Kong 香港, Macao 澳門|澳门 and Taiwan 臺灣|台湾[Tai2 wan1]
